mdq:check.name: Entity Attribute Storage Type Present
mdq:check.description: Check that a storage type exits for each attribute.
mdq:check.code:
def call(): global output global status global attributeStorageType global attributeName
import metadig.variable as mvar maxPrint = 5 NoneType = type(None)
# Check if an attribute storage type is present for each attribute.
if not attributesPresent: output = "No attributes are present, so unable to check for attribute storage type." status = "FAILURE" return False
# If attributes are present, they can have a storage type (in EML), so fail if none are found. if not attributeStorageTypePresent: output = "No attribute storage types are present." status = "FAILURE" return False
attributeStorageType = mvar.toUnicode(attributeStorageType) attributeName = mvar.toUnicode(attributeName)
# If only a single value is returned (vs type "list"), then convert to a list # for easier processing if(isinstance(attributeStorageType, unicode)): attributeStorageType = [attributeStorageType]
if(isinstance(attributeName, unicode)): attributeName = [attributeName]
attributeCount = 0 missing = []
for i in range(0, len(attributeStorageType)): attributeCount += 1 storageType = attributeStorageType[i] name = attributeName[i] if(isinstance(name, NoneType) or mvar.isBlank(name)): name = "attr #{}.format(i)" # No storageType for this attribute was specified if(storageType == None or mvar.isBlank(storageType)): missing.append(name)
if(len(missing) > 0): output = u"These attributes do not have a storage type: '{}'".format(', '.join(missing[0:maxPrint])) if(len(missing) > maxPrint): output += u", ..." status = "FAILURE" return False else: output = "All {} attributes have a storage type".format(attributeCount) status = "SUCCESS" return True
